question: What are the main causes of flooding in South Sudan?
answer: Flooding in South Sudan is caused by: 1) Heavy seasonal rainfall (May-October), 2) White Nile and tributary overflow, 3) Poor drainage infrastructure, 4) Deforestation reducing water absorption, 5) Climate change intensifying rainfall patterns, 6) Flat terrain in flood-prone areas.
